content.description:
This problem starts on a massive jug rail and moves straight up to another comfy jug rail.

Although this boulder problem is just one move, the route can be topped out by stepping up over the large flake. Although, it's really not worth the trouble to walk all the way around for the downclimb.

This is an incredible and very serious highball just downhill from

Five Year Plan

. Start grabbing a jug at about 7 feet. Climb the crimps and jugs on the gently overhanging face until the lip at about 20 feet. Find a quarter pad crimp rail in the slot, and pull over the lip to climb through the feature. The original line finishes directly up the slab, topping out at close to 50 feet. You can also climb the dihedral to the right that gets you to about 35 feet. Both are easy and secure finishes, although they are exposed.

Beta video:

https://youtu.be/MQ5eyH_MJqY

.
content.location:
Go just down trail from

5 Year Plan

about 2 minutes across the open area to the south from three shots. It might take a second to find it, but when you see it, you will know.

content.description:
Three Shots is a beautiful looking line with questionable rock. Start sitting on the obvious jug plate, and climb through the perfectly placed slimpers and sidepulls. A beta video:

https://youtu.be/bTCMq1MCAyE

.
content.location: It is on the obvious “Africa-shaped” wall.

content.description: SDS in the hole with your left hand on the arete and you right hand on the lowest right hand sidepull. This is just a good clean climb on good, clean rock.
content.location: Go uphill along the backside of Lost Porch for 30 meters until you are above the slabby boulder sitting just south from the face. Traverse into the alcove above this boulder.

content.description: Start matched near an arch, and move up and left finding large holds hidden behind the flake.

Start matched on the lower slot. Move upwards to mantel.

Muffin Time!

A video:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LACbVhgtx9I

.
content.location:
Continue along the trail a short ways (50 meters) until the trail takes a sharp right at a small boulder (8 feet tall). Go straight uphill passing a large boulder off to the right, and continue up as the slot narrows leading up to the boulder.

GPS coordinates are: 39.97549, -105.28978.

content.description:
Climb the amazing, swooped slab feature through crimps and underclings to a spooky lip encounter.

A beta video:

https://youtu.be/zFOQKyPiLWE

.
content.location:
It is very obviously to the left about 30 yards when looking at

Three Shots

.

content.description: Start matched in the crack, and go up. This delightful crack transitions from thin hands all the way up to an offwidth at the top. Beyond its aesthetics, the crack is uniquely lined with pebbles throughout. With patience, the line flows, but when forced, the crack has a tendency to bite. This boulder has the possibility for many more routes and variations.
content.location:
Continue along the trail a short ways (50 meters) until the trail takes a sharp right at a small boulder (8 feet tall). Instead, go up left of the boulder where you should be able to see a pebbled, vertical SE face. The crack lies on the eastern side of the block.

GPS coordinates are:

39.97565, -105.28938

.

content.description:
Start as far right as you want, and traverse left heading into

Ankylosaurus

.

Move up the huecoed wall. Topping out over the bulge is the crux. This route is used as a downclimb for the other routes on the wall. If you are uncomfortable downclimbing, there is another downclimb/walkoff 20 meters NW.
